question: The Mughal School of Painting formed the spinal column of the various schools of Indian miniature art. Which one of the following painting styles was not affected by Mughal painting?
explanation: Kalighat painting was originated in the 19th century, West Bengal. It was in the vicinity of Kalighat Kali Temple, Kalighat, Calcutta and from being items of souvenir taken by the visitors to the Kali temple, the paintings over a period of time developed as a distinct school of Indian painting.
